thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger reveals what will make him stay | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger reveals what will make him stay | Metro News

author: Evan Bartlett For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger reveals what will make him stay | Metro News
text:
Evan Bartlett for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 11:14 am The Frenchman sounds like he could be tempted to stay on next season (Getty Images) 
Arsene Wenger has reaffirmed that he will make a decision on his future in March or April but has revealed no amount of pleading from his players will influence him. 
The Arsenal boss has come in for severe criticism after his side’s humbling 5-1 defeat to Bayern Munich on Wednesday. 
With the club’s title challenge already looking over too, many feel the Frenchman should end his 20-year Arsenal career this summer. 
In the wake of that defeat in Germany, Wenger said he would decide whether to stay or not in the next couple of months but confirmed he would not retire. 
‘No matter what happens I will manage next season,’ the Frenchman said. Wenger has been told it’s time to leave by fans, pundits and former players like Martin Keown this week (AMA/Corbis) 
‘Whether it is here or somewhere else, that is absolutely for sure. 
‘I hate defeat, I hate to lose games. I have a big responsibility at this club. It is difficult to take but I have the strength and experience. Arsene Wenger in numbers
